info.name: Precentral gyrus
info.description: The precental gyrus is a vertically-oriented gyrus of the cerebral hemisphere located immediately anterior to the central sulcus. Functionally, it serves as the primary motor cortex. The body and head are represented somatotopically within the gyrus such that the head is located laterally near the lateral sulcus and the feet are located most medially in the longitudinal fissure. In Brodmann's designation, this gyrus is termed Area 4.
